content: Will have portions of the site that are accessible only to authenticated users; I see the module to set permissions by role for menus, but not to set them for individual pages or particular paths and wildcards? (Vaguely recalling this could be done with layouts, but not sure if that's the right tree in this forest.)
There are a few different "access" modules. I've used this one on a few sites: https://backdropcms.org/project/content_view_access
So if I'm reading that right, the simplest way about this is to install that module, then create a content-type such as "members page" which anonymous users can't reach?
Yes, that's how this one works. :+1:
I've also created custom module for one off sites where a field is added to a content type and then check for the status of that field with the access hook

@StPaulTim this thread got me to thinking about porting Taxonomy Access Control or Taxonomy Access Control Lite.
noticed that you started on tac_lite a while ago.
wondering if you think I should start from forking your repo or start from scratch?
